Key Match Events: Sri Lanka registered their first win in the ongoing ICC Men's ODI World Cup 2023 by defeating the Netherlands by 5 wickets with 10 balls remaining.
Netherlands scored 262 runs in 49.5 overs, with Sybrand Engelbrecht scoring 70 and Logan van Beek scoring 59.
Dilshan Madushanka and Kasun Rajitha took 4 wickets each for Sri Lanka.
Pathum Nissanka scored 54, Sadeera Samarawickrama scored an unbeaten 91, and Charith Asalanka scored 44 for Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka chased the target of 263 runs in 48.2 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Netherlands won the toss and decided to bat first.
This was the first time the Netherlands batted first against Sri Lanka in their ODI encounters.
The pitch at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium was expected to benefit the bowlers.
There was no chance of rain, with the temperature predicted to be 31 degrees with 82% humidity.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka moved up to number 9 in the ICC points tally with 2 points, despite being below the Netherlands due to Net Run Rate difference.
Sri Lanka had played 4 matches and won just one in the tournament so far.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands had previously defeated South Africa by 38 runs in their last match on October 17.
Sri Lanka had lost all 3 matches before this win, including a defeat by Australia by 5 wickets.
The Netherlands and Sri Lanka had played 5 ODIs before this match, with the Netherlands failing to defeat Sri Lanka even once.
